title: PHPasin()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPasin()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Return the arc sine of different numbers: "); echo(asin(-0.4) . "
"); echo(asin(0) . "
"); echo(asin(-1) . "
"); echo(asin(1) . "
"); echo(asin(2)); ?> Definition and Usage The asin() function returns the arc sine of a number. Tip: asin(1) returns the value of Pi/2. Syntax asin( number ); Parameter Values Parameter Description number Required. Specifies a number in range -1 to 1 Technical Details Return Value: The arc sine of a number. Returns NAN if number is not in the range -1 to 1 Return Type: Float PHP Version: 4+ ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
"); echo(asin(-0.4) . "
"); echo(asin(0) . "
"); echo(asin(-1) . "
"); echo(asin(1) . "
"); echo(asin(2)); ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPasin()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPasin()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPasin()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
